courses.title: Communication (Core)
courses.prerequisite: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Option: ENGL 1301.

courses.title: Calculus I (Core)
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2412 with a grade of C or better; or passing the Pre-Calculus exemption test administered by the Department of Mathematics.

courses.title: Introduction to Civil Engineering*
courses.notes: *This course and CIVE 2220 should be your first CIVE courses.

courses.title: Civil Engineering Measurements**
courses.notes: **This course and CIVE 1101 should be your first CIVE courses.

courses.title: Chemistry for Engineers
courses.prerequisite: MATH 1314, MATH 1414, MATH 2412, or MATH 2413 with a grade of 'C' or higher.

courses.title: Chemistry for Engineers Lab
courses.prerequisite: Credit/registration in CHEM 1309.

courses.title: 1301 Learning Framework; 1101 Academic and Career Success; 1001 Living and Working by Design
courses.notes: As required, based on credit hours earned, TSI status, High School rank, major declaration.

courses.title: Communication (Core)
courses.prerequisite: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Options: ENGL 1302 or ENGL 1305.

courses.title: Calculus II
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2413 with a grade of 'C' or better.

courses.title: Physics for Scientists and Engineers I (Core)
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2413.
courses.notes: 1 hour of lab for Core 090. See General Education Core for more details.

courses.title: Engineering Statistics
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2413 and credit for or enrollment in MATH 2414.

courses.title: Civil Engineering Materials
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 1101 and CHEM 1309/1109.

courses.title: Calculus III
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2414 with a grade of 'C' or better.

courses.title: Statics
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in CIVE 1101 and PHYS 2425; a grade of 'C' or better or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2414.

courses.title: Numerical Methods for Civil Engineers
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2414.

courses.title: Physics for Scientists and Engineers II (Core)
courses.prerequisite: PHYS 2425 and MATH 2414.
courses.notes: 1 hour of lab for Core 090. See General Education Core for more details.

courses.title: American History (Core)
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Options: HIST 1302 or HIST 2328.

courses.title: Dynamics
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 2301 and MATH 2414.

courses.title: Mechanics of Materials
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in MECE 2301 and MATH 2414.

courses.title: Differential Equations
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2414 with a grade of 'C' or better.

courses.title: Fluid Mechanics and Hydraulics
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in MECE 2301 and MATH 2415.

courses.title: Fluid Mechanics and Hydraulics Lab
courses.prerequisite: CIVE 3315. May be taken concurrently.

courses.title: Engineering Economics
courses.prerequisite: Credit/registration in MANE 3332.

courses.title: Structural Analysis I
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 3321 and CIVE 3440.

courses.title: Environmental Engineering
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 3315, CIVE 3115, and CHEM 1309/1109.

courses.title: Geotechnical Engineering and Applications
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 3321.

courses.title: Structural Steel Design
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 3324.

courses.title: Transportation Engineering
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 2220 and MECE 2302.

courses.title: Water Resources Engineering
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in [CIVE 3315 and CIVE 3115], MATH 3341, and CIVE 2350 or MECE 2350.

courses.title: Reinforced Concrete Design
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 3324.

courses.title: Social and Behavioral Sciences (Core)
courses.notes: See General Education Core for course options.

courses.title: Construction Planning & Management
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in MANE 3337 and PHYS 2426.

courses.title: Prescribed Elective I
courses.notes: Choose any two of these 4000-level courses, or one 4000-level and one of the 3000-level courses: CIVE 4300, 4315, 4333, 4340, 4348, 4350, 4351, 4352, 4359, 3300, 3100 (repeat for 3 credits).

courses.title: Foundation Design
courses.prerequisite: Minimum grade of 'C' in CIVE 3475.

courses.title: CE Senior Fundamentals
courses.prerequisite: Senior Standing, a minimum GPA of 2.4 and a grade of C or better in CIVE 3324, CIVE 3331, CIVE 3345, CIVE 3475 and CIVE 4335.

courses.title: Prescribed Elective II
courses.notes: Choose any two of these 4000-level courses, or one 4000-level and one of the 3000-level courses: CIVE 4300, 4315, 4333, 4340, 4348, 4350, 4351, 4352, 4359, 3300, 3100 (repeat for 3 credits).

courses.title: Creative Arts (Core)
courses.notes: See General Education Core for course options.

courses.title: CE Senior Project
courses.prerequisite: A minimum GPA of 2.4, Senior Standing, and maximum 15 hrs enrolled in the semester.

courses.title: Basic Science Elective
courses.notes: Choose one of the following: BIOL 1406; ENVR 1401; GEOL 1401; GEOL 1403; GEOL 1404; GEOL 4411.

courses.title: Integrative & Experiential Learning (Core)
courses.notes: Complete an additional 3 hours from this section of the Core Curriculum except PHIL 2326.
